subject: Re: new to esclipse and can't get junit configured
msgSnippet: Hey Guys, I GOT IT!  Between the two of you, you had the right answer ;-)  In the Install New Software dialog under Galileo there was nothing there specific
messageBody:
Hey Guys,

I GOT IT! Between the two of you, you had the right answer ;-) In the "Install New Software" dialog under Galileo there was nothing there specific to JUnit. But it occurred to me that installing "EPP Java Package" and "Java EE IDE Feature" was a reasonable thing to do.

Did that and now JUnit 4.5 is install and I can access the features I previously mentioned were lacking.

Thanks!
